The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] For the sketch of part 1, create a face and a loop: * Face 1 + Loop 1 - Line 1 * Start Point: [0.0, 0.0] * End Point: [0.15, 0.0] - Line 2 * Start Point: [0.15, 0.0] * End Point: [0.15, 0.225] - Line 3 * Start Point: [0.15, 0.225] * End Point: [0.0, 0.225] - Line 4 * Start Point: [0.0, 0.225] * End Point: [0.0, 0.0] For the extrudion of part 1, perform the following actions: * Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.15 * Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.225 * Operation: Create a new solid body. **Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a metallic rod or tube.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 2: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.03, 0.0675, 0.15] For the sketch of part 2, create a face and loop: * Face 1 + Loop 1 - Circle 1 * Center: [0.045, 0.045] * Radius: 0.045 For the extrusion of part 2, perform the following actions: * Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.6 * Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.09 * Operation: Join or add materials. The resulting model will be a cylindrical object with a rectangular hole in the center, connected by a cylindrical rod. The dimensions of each part are: * Part 1: length 0.225, width 0.225, height 0.15 * Part 2: length 0.09, width 0.09, height 0.6</description>
